question:
Which of the following is / are correct statements with respect to the Dam Rehabilitation & Improvement Project that was making news recently?
  1. Its objective is to rehabilitate the old dams in the country
  2. It is being implemented in all the states of India with the help of World Bank
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation:
The Dam Rehabilitation and Improvement Project (DRIP) is an attempt to improve the safety and operational performance of selected existing dams in a sustainable manner. Features of the DRIP:
  • The DRIP aims to strengthen the dam safety institutional setup of participating States / Implementing Agencies.
  • The project aims at rehabilitation of old dams in country experiencing distress and are in need of attention for ensuring their structural safety and operational efficiency.
  • The project also provides for Strengthening institutional capacity and project management.
  • The project also attempts at bringing greater awareness on dam safety issues and finding novel solutions to address them by pooling best knowledge, technologies and experience available around the world.
  • The project is undertaken in association with World Bank. 80% of the total project is provided by the World Bank as loan/credit and remaining 20% is borne by the States / Central Government (for CWC). 
  • The participating states are Jharkhand, Karnataka, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, and Uttarakhand.
  • Rehabilitation works for 198 dams have been awarded under the project.
  • Dam managers would have to adhere to recommendations by the CWC and subject themselves to six monthly reviews by the World Bank and an audit by an external agency.
  • The primary beneficiaries are both urban and rural communities dependent on reservoir and downstream communities, who are prone to risk associated with dam failure or operational failure.
Launched in 2012 with an outlay of Rs. 2100 crore the project was scheduled to be completed by June 2018. The project has been extended till 2020.
